verses.roman:
bāhire pratāparudra lañā pātra-gaṇa
maṇḍala hañā kare loka nivāraṇa

synonyms: bāhire—outside; pratāparudra—King Pratāparudra; lañā—taking; pātra-gaṇa—his own associates; maṇḍala—circle; hañā—becoming; kare—does; loka—of the crowd; nivāraṇa—checking.
translation: Mahārāja Pratāparudra and his personal assistants formed a third circle around the two inner circles just to check the crowd from coming too near.
